meanings.definition: To make more promises than one can fulfill.
meanings.sent1: She always overpromised, but rarely delivered on her commitments.
meanings.sent2: He overpromised his help to everyone, but ended up letting them down.
meanings.sent3: The magician overpromised that he could make an elephant disappear, but it magically reappeared!
meanings.sent4: The politician overpromised a bright future, but reality hit hard.
meanings.sent5: The salesman overpromised the benefits of the product, leaving customers disappointed.

meanings.definition: To promise more than one can deliver.
meanings.sent1: They overpromised a quick solution to the problem, but it took much longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The company overpromised on the quality of their service, leading to customer complaints.
meanings.sent3: The chef overpromised a mouth-watering dish, but it turned out to be bland.
meanings.sent4: The weather forecast overpromised clear skies, yet it rained heavily all day.
meanings.sent5: The student overpromised a perfect score, but reality proved otherwise.
